meanings.definition: To carry out (a task) clumsily or incompetently.
meanings.sent1: He bungled the presentation by forgetting his lines.
meanings.sent2: She always bungled her attempts at baking cookies.
meanings.sent3: The magician bungled his trick, making the rabbit disappear forever.
meanings.sent4: The detective bungled the investigation, letting the criminal escape.
meanings.sent5: The student bungled the exam, answering all the questions wrong.

meanings.definition: To make a mess of; botch.
meanings.sent1: The chef bungled the recipe, adding too much salt.
meanings.sent2: They bungled the repair job, causing more damage to the car.
meanings.sent3: The actor bungled his lines, turning the serious scene into a comedy.
meanings.sent4: The artist bungled the painting, mixing all the colors together.
meanings.sent5: The gardener bungled the pruning, leaving the bushes looking uneven.
